description: Complete FrontDesk Module - Team Section features and Tickets P0 gaps (Coming, Waiting, In-Service, Pending)

userStories.title: Connect StaffCard displayConfig to FrontDeskSettings
userStories.description: As a salon manager, I want the staff card display options from FrontDesk Settings to actually control what's shown on staff cards, so that my configuration preferences are applied.
acceptanceCriteria: StaffSidebar reads showTurnCount, showNextAppointment, showServicedAmount, showTicketCount, showLastDone, showMoreOptionsButton from FrontDeskSettings
StaffSidebar passes these settings to StaffCardVertical via displayConfig prop
Toggling settings in FrontDesk Settings panel immediately updates staff card display
pnpm run typecheck passes
Verify in browser: toggle showTurnCount off in FrontDesk Settings and confirm turn count disappears from staff cards
userStories.notes: File: apps/store-app/src/components/frontdesk/StaffSidebar.tsx

userStories.title: Add More Options dropdown menu to StaffCard
userStories.description: As a front desk coordinator, I want a More Options menu on staff cards that shows contextual actions, so that I can quickly perform team-related tasks.
acceptanceCriteria: StaffCardVertical shows a MoreVertical icon button that opens a dropdown menu on click
Dropdown menu uses Radix UI DropdownMenu component
Menu items are controlled by showAddTicketAction, showAddNoteAction, showEditTeamAction, showQuickCheckoutAction settings from displayConfig
Menu shows placeholder text for each action (actual functionality in later stories)
Menu closes when clicking outside or pressing Escape
pnpm run typecheck passes
Verify in browser: click More Options button and see dropdown menu with enabled action items
userStories.notes: File: apps/store-app/src/components/StaffCard/StaffCardVertical.tsx. More button exists but has no menu. Add DropdownMenu from @radix-ui/react-dropdown-menu.

userStories.title: Implement Add Ticket action on staff cards
userStories.description: As a front desk coordinator, I want to quickly add a new ticket for a staff member from their card, so that I can assign walk-in clients efficiently.
acceptanceCriteria: Add Ticket option appears in More Options menu when showAddTicketAction is true
Clicking Add Ticket triggers onAddTicket callback passed to StaffCardVertical
StaffSidebar handles onAddTicket by opening the existing walk-in flow with staff pre-selected
The action is hidden when showAddTicketAction is false in settings
pnpm run typecheck passes
Verify in browser: click Add Ticket on a staff card and see the create ticket flow initiated with that staff pre-selected
userStories.notes: Reuse existing CreateTicketButton or WalkInFlow components. Pass staffId to pre-select the staff member.

userStories.title: Implement Add Note action on staff cards
userStories.description: As a front desk coordinator, I want to add a note to a staff member from their card, so that I can communicate important information.
acceptanceCriteria: Add Note option appears in More Options menu when showAddNoteAction is true
Clicking Add Note triggers onAddNote callback passed to StaffCardVertical
StaffSidebar handles onAddNote by opening the AddNoteModal for that staff member
The action is hidden when showAddNoteAction is false in settings
pnpm run typecheck passes
Verify in browser: click Add Note on a staff card and see the note modal open
userStories.notes: File: apps/store-app/src/components/frontdesk/AddNoteModal.tsx exists. Need to add state for selected staff and pass to modal.

userStories.title: Implement Edit Team Member action on staff cards
userStories.description: As a salon manager, I want to quickly edit a team member's details from their card, so that I can update information without navigating away.
acceptanceCriteria: Edit Team Member option appears in More Options menu when showEditTeamAction is true
Clicking triggers onEditTeam callback passed to StaffCardVertical
StaffSidebar handles onEditTeam by navigating to /team/[staffId] or opening a side panel
The action is hidden when showEditTeamAction is false in settings
pnpm run typecheck passes
Verify in browser: click Edit Team Member and navigate to team settings for that staff
userStories.notes: Can use React Router navigate to /team/settings with staff ID, or open TeamSettingsPanel with pre-selected staff.

userStories.title: Implement Quick Checkout action on staff cards
userStories.description: As a front desk coordinator, I want to quickly checkout a staff member's current ticket, so that I can process payments faster.
acceptanceCriteria: Quick Checkout option appears in More Options menu when showQuickCheckoutAction is true AND staff has active tickets
Clicking triggers onQuickCheckout callback with the staff's current ticketId
StaffSidebar handles onQuickCheckout by opening the checkout panel for that ticket
Option is disabled/hidden when staff has no active tickets
The action is hidden when showQuickCheckoutAction is false in settings
pnpm run typecheck passes
Verify in browser: click Quick Checkout on a busy staff member's card and see checkout open
userStories.notes: Link to existing checkout flow. Only show for busy staff with activeTickets. Use the first in-service ticket.

userStories.title: Apply FrontDeskSettings to MobileTeamSection
userStories.description: As a mobile user, I want the FrontDesk Settings to apply to the mobile team view, so that my preferences are consistent across devices.
acceptanceCriteria: MobileTeamSection reads settings from FrontDeskSettings Redux slice using useAppSelector
organizeBy setting controls grouping (busyStatus shows Ready/Busy groups, clockedStatus shows Clocked In/Out)
Card data toggles (showTurnCount, showNextAppointment, showServicedAmount, showTicketCount, showLastDone) apply to mobile staff cards via displayConfig
pnpm run typecheck passes
Verify on mobile viewport: toggle showTurnCount off in FrontDesk Settings and confirm it updates mobile team view
userStories.notes: File: apps/store-app/src/components/frontdesk/MobileTeamSection.tsx. Currently ignores FrontDeskSettings.

userStories.title: Connect StaffCard to real ticket data
userStories.description: As a front desk coordinator, I want staff cards to show real current client and service information for busy staff, so that I have accurate floor visibility.
acceptanceCriteria: StaffSidebar uses useAppSelector to get tickets from ticketsSlice
For each staff member, find their assigned in-service ticket
Pass real currentTicketInfo to StaffCardVertical: clientName, serviceName, startTime, progress
Removes hardcoded dummy ticket data
Progress is calculated from ticket service startTime vs estimated duration
pnpm run typecheck passes
Verify in browser: create a ticket for a staff member and see their card update with real client/service data
userStories.notes: Currently StaffSidebar adds dummy ticket info for busy staff. Need to integrate with ticketsSlice.

userStories.title: Connect StaffCard to real appointment data
userStories.description: As a front desk coordinator, I want staff cards to show real next appointment times, so that I can see upcoming workload.
acceptanceCriteria: StaffSidebar uses useAppSelector to get appointments from appointmentsSlice
For each staff member, find their next upcoming appointment
Pass real nextAppointmentTime to StaffCardVertical from actual appointment data
Last service time is calculated from most recent completed ticket for that staff
Removes hardcoded lastServiceTime and nextAppointmentTime mock values
pnpm run typecheck passes
Verify in browser: book an appointment for a staff member and see their card update with real next appointment time
userStories.notes: Currently uses mock data ('10:30 AM', '2:00 PM'). Need to integrate with appointmentsSlice.

userStories.title: Add staff card click handler for details
userStories.description: As a front desk coordinator, I want to click a staff card to see their full details and current workload.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking anywhere on staff card (not on action buttons) triggers onClick callback
StaffSidebar handles onClick by opening a staff details panel/modal
Details panel shows: current tickets, upcoming appointments, today's stats, quick actions
Panel can be closed with X button or clicking outside
pnpm run typecheck passes
Verify in browser: click a staff card and see details panel open
userStories.notes: Currently clicking staff card does nothing useful. Should show expanded staff view.

userStories.title: Add Mobile staff card actions
userStories.description: As a mobile user, I want to access staff actions from mobile team view, so that I have the same functionality as desktop.
acceptanceCriteria: MobileTeamSection passes action callbacks to StaffCardVertical
Long-press or tap on staff card shows action sheet (mobile-friendly alternative to dropdown)
Action sheet includes: Add Ticket, Add Note, Edit Team Member, Quick Checkout
Actions respect the same settings as desktop (showAddTicketAction, etc.)
pnpm run typecheck passes
Verify on mobile viewport: tap/long-press a staff card and see action sheet
userStories.notes: MobileTeamSection currently has no action handlers. Use Radix UI AlertDialog or Sheet for mobile action sheet.

userStories.title: Add staff clock in/out action
userStories.description: As a salon manager, I want to quickly clock staff in or out from their card, so that I can manage attendance efficiently.
acceptanceCriteria: More Options menu shows 'Clock In' for off/clocked-out staff
More Options menu shows 'Clock Out' for ready/busy staff
Clicking triggers clock in/out action via staffSlice or timesheetSlice
Staff status updates immediately after clock in/out
Confirmation dialog shown before clock out if staff has active tickets
pnpm run typecheck passes
Verify in browser: clock in an off staff member and see their status change to ready
userStories.notes: Useful for managers to manage team attendance from FrontDesk without navigating to Team module.

userStories.title: Add unit tests for Team Section components
userStories.description: As a developer, I want unit tests for Team Section components, so that we can prevent regressions.
acceptanceCriteria: StaffSidebar.test.tsx created with tests for: rendering, filtering, settings integration
StaffCardVertical.test.tsx created with tests for: display modes, action callbacks, displayConfig
MobileTeamSection.test.tsx created with tests for: rendering, filtering, settings integration
Tests use existing test utilities from src/testing/
All tests pass with pnpm test
pnpm run typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Current test coverage is ~3.5%. Add basic tests for the main Team Section components.

userStories.title: Add No-Show action for late appointments
userStories.description: As a front desk coordinator, I want to mark appointments as no-show when clients are 15+ minutes late so that I can accurately track attendance and free up staff.
acceptanceCriteria: No-Show action button appears in appointment action menu when appointment is 15+ minutes past scheduled time
No-Show action changes appointment status to 'no-show'
No-Show action removes appointment from Coming section
Confirmation dialog appears before marking as no-show
pnpm run typecheck passes
Verify in browser: Open Front Desk, find late appointment, click action menu, see No-Show option
userStories.notes: FD-BR-007. File: apps/store-app/src/components/frontdesk/ComingAppointments.tsx. Late appointments already grouped with minutesUntil < 0.

userStories.title: Implement drag and drop for Waiting Queue reordering
userStories.description: As a front desk coordinator, I want to drag and drop tickets in the Waiting Queue to reorder them so that I can prioritize clients based on business needs.
acceptanceCriteria: When enableDragAndDrop setting is true, waiting tickets can be dragged to reorder
Drag handle or grab cursor indicates draggable items
Visual feedback shows drag state and drop target
Order persists after reordering (stored in Redux state)
Drag and drop works in both grid and list view modes
pnpm run typecheck passes
Verify in browser: Enable drag and drop in settings, drag a ticket card to reorder
userStories.notes: FD-P0-102. File: apps/store-app/src/components/frontdesk/WaitListSection.tsx. Use @dnd-kit/core. enableDragAndDrop setting exists in frontDeskSettingsSlice.

userStories.title: Update In-Service progress bar base color to Light Blue
userStories.description: As a salon manager, I want in-service ticket progress bars to show Light Blue color by default so that the visual design matches the PRD specification.
acceptanceCriteria: Progress bars show Light Blue color when progress is 0-79%
Progress bars show Green color when progress is 80-100%
Progress bars show Red color when progress exceeds 100% (overdue)
Color applies consistently in ServiceTicketCard and ServiceTicketCardRefactored
pnpm run typecheck passes
Verify in browser: Navigate to In-Service section, observe progress bar colors
userStories.notes: FD-P0-003/004. File: apps/store-app/src/components/tickets/ServiceTicketCard.tsx. Currently uses Purple, should use Light Blue per PRD.

userStories.title: Update urgency thresholds to match Pending PRD specification
userStories.description: As a product owner, I want urgency thresholds to match the PRD specification so that visual escalation happens at the correct wait times.
acceptanceCriteria: DEFAULT_URGENCY_THRESHOLDS in urgencyUtils.ts updated to: attention: 5, urgent: 10, critical: 20
URGENCY_COLORS updated to match PRD: normal=white/neutral, attention=yellow, urgent=orange, critical=red
getUrgencyLevel function returns correct level for each threshold
Existing urgency sorting functions continue to work correctly
pnpm run typecheck passes
userStories.notes: File: apps/store-app/src/utils/urgencyUtils.ts. Current thresholds (10/15/20) don't match PRD (5/10/20). Dependency for US-018.

userStories.title: Add urgency color-coding to PendingTicketCard based on wait time
userStories.description: As a front desk coordinator, I want pending ticket cards to change color based on how long they've been waiting so that I can quickly identify clients who need immediate attention.
acceptanceCriteria: Pending ticket cards show White/neutral theme when waiting <5 minutes
Pending ticket cards show Yellow theme when waiting 5-10 minutes
Pending ticket cards show Orange theme when waiting 10-20 minutes
Pending ticket cards show Red theme when waiting 20+ minutes
Theme affects card border, background gradient, and accent colors
pnpm run typecheck passes
Verify in browser: Navigate to Pending footer, see different colors based on wait time
userStories.notes: PND-P0-004. File: apps/store-app/src/components/tickets/PendingTicketCard.tsx. Depends on US-017 for correct thresholds.

userStories.title: Add wait time display to PendingTicketCard in collapsed footer
userStories.description: As a front desk coordinator, I want to see how long each pending ticket has been waiting directly on the card so that I can quickly prioritize checkouts.
acceptanceCriteria: Wait time displayed on ticket cards in collapsed footer mode (e.g., '5m', '12m', '25m')
Wait time updates periodically (every 30 seconds minimum)
Wait time uses formatWaitingTime from urgencyUtils.ts
Wait time display is visually distinct (badge or label format)
pnpm run typecheck passes
Verify in browser: Navigate to Pending footer, see wait time on each ticket card
userStories.notes: PND-P0-003. File: apps/store-app/src/components/tickets/PendingTicketCard.tsx. completedAt field exists on tickets for calculating wait time.

userStories.title: Add First Visit badge to Coming Appointments
userStories.description: As a front desk coordinator, I want to see a 'First Visit' badge on appointments for new clients so that I can provide extra attention to first-time visitors.
acceptanceCriteria: First Visit badge displays on appointments where client is new (no previous visits)
Badge is visually distinct (e.g., 'NEW' badge) next to client name
Badge appears in all timeframe buckets (late, next hour, later)
Badge styling is consistent with existing VIP badge
pnpm run typecheck passes
Verify in browser: See First Visit badge on new client appointments
userStories.notes: FD-P1-007. File: apps/store-app/src/components/frontdesk/ComingAppointments.tsx. Check isFirstVisit logic in client data.

userStories.title: Add client photo to Coming Appointment cards
userStories.description: As a front desk coordinator, I want to see client photos on appointment cards so that I can recognize clients when they arrive.
acceptanceCriteria: Client photo displayed on appointment cards when available
Default avatar shown when no photo available
Photo size is appropriate for card layout (32px)
Photo is circular with subtle border
pnpm run typecheck passes
Verify in browser: See client photos on appointment cards
userStories.notes: FD-P0-006. File: apps/store-app/src/components/frontdesk/ComingAppointments.tsx. clientPhoto field in appointment/client data.

userStories.title: Add staff photo to ticket cards
userStories.description: As a front desk coordinator, I want to see staff photos on ticket cards so that I can quickly identify which technician is assigned.
acceptanceCriteria: Staff photo displayed on ticket cards in Waiting and In-Service sections
Photo shown as circular avatar (32px) next to staff name badge
Default avatar with staff initial when no photo available
Photo integrated with existing staff color badge design
pnpm run typecheck passes
Verify in browser: See staff photos on ticket cards
userStories.notes: FD-P0-005. Files: apps/store-app/src/components/tickets/WaitListTicketCard.tsx, ServiceTicketCard.tsx. Staff data includes photo field.

userStories.title: Persist view mode preferences across sessions
userStories.description: As a user, I want my view mode preferences (grid/list, compact/normal) to persist across browser sessions.
acceptanceCriteria: View mode (grid/list) persists to localStorage on change
Card view mode (compact/normal) persists to localStorage on change
Settings restored from localStorage on component mount
Each section (Waiting, In-Service) has independent preferences
pnpm run typecheck passes
Verify in browser: Change view mode, refresh page, view mode persisted
userStories.notes: FD-P0-015. File: apps/store-app/src/hooks/useTicketSection.ts. useTicketSection hook may have localStorage logic - verify it works.

userStories.title: Add section count badges to collapsed Coming section header
userStories.description: As a front desk coordinator, I want to see count badges on the collapsed Coming section header.
acceptanceCriteria: Total appointment count shown in header badge when collapsed
Late count shown separately when > 0 (red badge)
Badges update in real-time as appointments check in
pnpm run typecheck passes
Verify in browser: Collapse Coming section, verify count badges visible
userStories.notes: FD-P0-021. File: apps/store-app/src/components/frontdesk/ComingAppointments.tsx. Verified: header badges already implemented - total count shown always, late count shown in red when > 0. Header renders in both collapsed and expanded states.

userStories.title: Add live status update indicator to ticket cards
userStories.description: As a salon manager, I want visual feedback when ticket status changes in real-time.
acceptanceCriteria: Brief highlight animation when ticket status changes
Animation subtle but noticeable (pulse or border flash)
Works for: check-in, start service, mark done transitions
Animation duration ~500ms
pnpm run typecheck passes
Verify in browser: Check in appointment, see visual feedback
userStories.notes: FD-P0-067. Added statusFlash animation to tailwind.config.js, created useStatusChangeAnimation hook, applied to ServiceTicketCard all 4 view modes. Green ring highlight fades over 500ms.

userStories.title: Add new ticket notification visual indicator
userStories.description: As a front desk coordinator, I want a visual notification when new bookings arrive.
acceptanceCriteria: New ticket indicator appears when appointment added to Coming section
Indicator is a badge or highlight on the section header
Indicator clears when section is viewed/expanded
pnpm run typecheck passes
Verify in browser: Add new appointment, see notification
userStories.notes: FD-P0-070. Added hasNewAppointments state + previousAppointmentCount ref. Blue 'New' badge with pulse animation shows when count increases and section is collapsed. Clears on expand.

userStories.title: Add Edit Ticket action to all ticket card menus
userStories.description: As a front desk coordinator, I want to edit ticket details directly from the ticket card menu.
acceptanceCriteria: Edit action available in ticket card dropdown menu
Edit action opens EditTicketModal with ticket data pre-filled
Works in Waiting, In-Service, and Pending sections
Modal allows adding/removing services
pnpm run typecheck passes
Verify in browser: Open ticket menu, click Edit, see modal
userStories.notes: FD-P0-042. Added Edit button with Edit2 icon to all ticket card dropdown menus: ServiceTicketCard (normal, grid-normal, grid-compact), ServiceTicketCardRefactored (grid-compact, grid-normal), PendingTicketCard (all 4 view modes). WaitListTicketCard already had Edit action. ServiceSection and PendingSectionFooter now pass onEdit handlers that open EditTicketModal.

userStories.title: Add Remove from Pending action
userStories.description: As a front desk coordinator, I want to remove a ticket from pending when a client leaves without paying.
acceptanceCriteria: Remove from Pending action available on PendingTicketCard
Action requires confirmation dialog with reason selection
Reason options: Client Left, Cancelled, Other
Removed ticket logged for audit trail
pnpm run typecheck passes
Verify in browser: Click Remove action, see confirmation dialog
userStories.notes: PND-P0-014. Added Remove button to all 4 view modes in PendingTicketCard. Created RemoveFromPendingModal with reason selection (Client Left, Cancelled, Other). Added removePendingTicket reducer for state management. Logs removal for audit trail.

userStories.title: Implement sort by setting for In-Service section
userStories.description: As a front desk coordinator, I want to sort In-Service tickets by either queue order or time.
acceptanceCriteria: Sort option in In-Service section header dropdown
Options: Queue order (turn tracker) or Time (chronological)
sortBy setting in frontDeskSettings controls sort behavior
Sort preference persists to localStorage
pnpm run typecheck passes
Verify in browser: Change sort setting, see tickets reorder
userStories.notes: FD-P0-095. File: apps/store-app/src/components/frontdesk/ServiceSection.tsx. sortBy setting exists in frontDeskSettingsSlice.

userStories.title: Add View Full Details action to PendingTicketCard
userStories.description: As a front desk coordinator, I want to view full ticket details from a pending ticket.
acceptanceCriteria: View Details action available on PendingTicketCard menu
Action opens TicketDetailsModal with full ticket information
Modal shows all services, prices, staff assignments
Works in both expanded and collapsed footer modes
pnpm run typecheck passes
Verify in browser: Click view details, see modal
userStories.notes: PND-P0-012. File: apps/store-app/src/components/tickets/PendingTicketCard.tsx. TicketDetailsModal exists - add integration.
